评论内容: Imagine COD turns into a tactical teamplay oriented shooter, while BF becomes a hero shooter ...
Battlefield is still not in a release state, its beta at best. The fact that it was released months ago is a huge spit in our faces by dice.
I honestly enjoyed 128 breakthrough, if you know what you’re getting into its quite fun. 64 player is the real deal though and closer to what Battlefield always has been.

128 player breakthrough was the only mode I actually liked on 2042 :( I liked the chaos and I will always prefer too much action to not enough like the other modes where you spend 40 mins walking between objectives looking for enemies just to get taken out because your playing carelessly due to lack of action
128 breakthrough was the only mode I played,  I played 64 for the first time and it wasn't as fun

So...they'll get rid of literally ANYTHING except the specialists, huh?
2042 continues to lose content, players, and the community's trust.

Interested in the Gears of War MCC - enjoyed the first and second game, though the story kind of wandered off in the third and as the series went on. As for 2042, it is the game which turned this Battlefielder into a CoD-gamer. Vanguard may be an underwhelming entry into the CoD series, but me and my brother are actually having consistent mindless fun. Can't say any of the tweaks Dice have made make any sense considering the overhaul the game needs to make it a Battlefield game.

Bro I’m hyped for the possibility of a gears style MCC. I just hope they also make it available on PC either through game pass or just straight up on steam. Who knows maybe PlayStation will do something like that also for killzone (a man can dream)

I'm just absolutely not reinstalling 2042 until the season one content drops. I decided a couple months back that I was just going to step away and give Dice a shot at fixing it. Hopefully coming back to the game with fresh eyes and new content will reignite my passion for Battlefield.

Completely off topic sort of - but with all these amazing remaster collections, like the rumored gears of war collection, and the recent mass effect collection (as well as MCC) I’m hoping that with obsidian and Bethesda both under Xbox they can do a full fallout remastered collection, with remastered fallout new Vegas I could die happy, I haven’t gotten it to run properly without massive mod overhauls and bug fixes since I played it on Xbox 360
Thanks to the update, I finally uninstalled BF. They're are doing literally everything wrong like how are you guys gonna butcher one of my favorite games like that
Don’t you need 128 players to have a 128 player mode ?

BATTLEFIELD was always a good "middle ground" between tactical military FPS games (like ARMA and SQUAD) and dumber "run and gun" military FPS games (like COD). Right now, it seems like it intends to be a "hero-based" game with less team/mode-strategy choices but, rather, a "strategy of one" Rambo style "everyone gets a trophy" type of game. I hate to say it, but it seems like it no longer matters to players who wins and who loses. I won't play this form of BATTLEFIELD either now or in the future. I just hope that DICE/EA returns to formula.
128 players is needed for testing at a minimum. Removing it completely loses them all that data and progress they can make while properly learning what comes with 128 players

Thanks for providing an objective commentary regarding BF2042 patch 4.1. I am one of the players that absolutely prefers the 128 player mode of breakthrough and I believe those maps are far superior to the 64 player maps. In the past the only time I played 64 player maps was when playing BF2042 using previous gen version to play with friends. And while I have received and answered a number of surveys from EA/DICE, I was never asked even ONCE whether I preferred 128 or 64 player breakthrough.
128 players is a big evolution for battlefield. Removing 128 Breakthrough was the worst decision that DICE could make.
Thanks for keeping up with 2042 despite the issues.
When talking about how finished 2042 is ask yourself: does it feel as finished as WW3? An actual pre release game?

The future attack helicopter of 2042 has no thermal,no secondary weapons for the gunner and no below radar 😪 Tow missiles reaching only 540m,127mm rockets being angled terribly by a programmer who created paint app,nice!

128p breaktrough can be good. If you have covers on maps.
If they redesign all of the maps, it will be as good as they advertised.
I think battlefield 2042 is on the right track, but they have a lot of work to do to make it a "next-gen" battlefield, pun intended.
I can't wait to not reinstall BF2042 when season 1 finally drops. 🙌
I’ll be jumping back in when season 1 drops. 🤞🙏💪
Idk if this is just me but the AK24 was supposed to lose its semi auto function. I can still use it no problem.
I get that 128 sucks but you cant just take it out, at least wait till the next game, they sold  bf2042 as 128 player. Jeez i cant stand DICE they're so confused on what they want the game to be.
I got my BF pre-order refund after the beta.  I know it was just a beta but there were simple mechanics/basics broken in beta that should not have been.

I'm so very upset that they took out 128 player breakthrough I loved the chaos it was the best part of the experience it made it feel like i was playing in an actual battlefield.... so super super f-ing lame 😒 🙄
Still a bit of lag on PS5 controller but I do like that they changed the sprint pace so it now actually feels like you are running.
I look forward to the GOW MCC, as long as it launches working unlike the MCC did.

4.1 has ruined the game further for me. Stuttering everywhere. The people at DICE obviously haven't worked on a Battlefield game before and they are all new recruits replacing the veterans that made the series so great.
64 players is ok imo. Hopefully in future, maps are better designed to support a more fluid flow of breakthrough matches. Baby steps
Can some one tell me how removing the armor plate form angles pack was an improvement?

Ah yes advertise having a big player count, doesn’t know how to properly make maps to support that player count, removes 128 player count mode and blames the mode instead of blaming themselves for developing the game in a horrible way. Player counts aren’t the problem, if games like Planetside 2 which came out a literal decade ago and it has a mode that can support 2000 player on one single map and games like arma that have no capped player limit do fine, then that just shows how trash Dice and EA are-at making and handling a new battlefield. I like 64v64 and I also like 32v32 and when I heard they were upping the player count in modes I was thrilled because it’s been 64 player matches for years and yes it worked but just have 64 player and 128 player modes both in the game at launch. I know they did end up adding 64 players permanently a month or two after launch but at that point the game was basically dead so why remove 128 player mode now? Like there’s no reason to remove content. But they should’ve never removed the class system which everyone is saying, and they just had to move specialists into hazard zone and have the classes in regular modes. That would’ve probably made hazard zone more populated cause it would’ve had the “exclusive” specialists in there so people could try them out. But it just ended up being a trash mode that died very quickly anyways.

Edit: I know it’s only 128 player breakthrough but still.
2042 hasn't released any new content, yet they are still bug fixing on a massive scale. tells you about the state of release and quality control at dice.

I tried playing BF2042 after the update. I got stuck on the same terrible map THREE TIMES IN A ROW.
I want to choose the MAPS that I play.

I enjoyed 128 Breakthrough but not as much as the 64 player version. While I'll miss that version of the mode I love the reworked Breakthrough maps for 64 players. I'm just sad that the console version of the game was bugged and they had to put it back to the old versions of the maps while they fix the problem.
Gears of War had a huge impact on my childhood. I could remember my sister playing this gritty scary game when I was a kid. Fast forward, I played gears 2, 3 and judgement. Cant Wait!
Crazy right, who would have thought that giving players what they want could make a franchise a lot of money right??!!??
I regret bf2042. worst AAA shooter of all time.

128 player breakthrough is the only reason I still played bf2042. Its the reason I bought the game. In a game lacking content, the update takes away the only good content. I've already Uninstalled. Rank S06.
